channel.title: How to use RS2 interfer maker by Lin.(Advance options by Demon)
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SfTykjOwH90
Show's how to use lins interfaces and such. I hope this help. First tut. . . So please, If I broke a rule, just say I'll remove.
As below someone said to put infomation about it as well, so here;(More in video)
You will download a picture, say you want a blue h'ween mask for your interface. What you would do it corp the image with teh blue h'ween mask and save it from paint as "bluemask.png" Then in the notepad/setting thing you would open it up and add this in it. the last number or what every number you would want it to be like this, "50=bluemask" and then when you go to insert a image and the number is 50, It would be a blue h'ween mask:) (Also you need to add the image to the sprites folder) I hope this has helped.

item.title: How to use RS2 interfer maker by Lin.(Advance options by Demon)
item.dc:creator: @demonlover14 demonlover14
item.description:
@demonlover14 wrote:

[quote=“spy man47, post:2, topic:338070”]No, you are not breaking the rule

But put information about it, Not just a vid…[/quote]
Alright thanks.
I will right now.

Read full topic

item.title: How to use RS2 interfer maker by Lin.(Advance options by Demon)
item.dc:creator: @demonlover14 demonlover14
item.description:
@demonlover14 wrote:

Show’s how to use lins interfaces and such.
I hope this help.
First tut. . .
So please, If I broke a rule, just say I’ll remove.

As below someone said to put infomation about it as well, so here;(More in video)

You will download a picture, say you want a blue h’ween mask for your interface.
What you would do it corp the image with teh blue h’ween mask and save it from paint as “bluemask.png”
Then in the notepad/setting thing you would open it up and add this in it. the last number or what every number you would want it to be like this, “50=bluemask” and then when you go to insert a image and the number is 50, It would be a blue h’ween mask:)
(Also you need to add the image to the sprites folder)
I hope this has helped.
